page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: In the last census Bratton Fleming had a population of 663. The village is on the edge of Exmoor and even within living memory was quite self-contained.Now many trades have disappeared. Three shops remain ,Post-office,General store and butcher.The White Hart is the only pub of three left in the village. Barnstaple is 8 miles away and it is there that most people go to work and shop. The village is essentially linear in shape rising approx. 250'in the course of its length.Two new estates branch of this main stem. The whole area is agricultural mostly of a pastoral nature. Settlement patterns are dispersed either in single farms or 2 or 3 house hamlets.
